content: Restaurant **Standing Sushi Bar** is a Japanese-food [restaurant chain](/wiki/Restaurant_chain) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) and [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia). It was started in August 2009 with its first outlet in [Raffles Place](/wiki/Raffles_Place). The company was founded by Howard Lo. Standing Sushi Bar presently has 3 outlets. The restaurant at [8Q SAM](/wiki/8Q_SAM) opened in September 2010, [Marina Bay Link Mall](/wiki/Marina_Bay_Financial_Centre) opened in November 2010, and the first branch in Indonesia opened at La Piazza, [Jakarta](/wiki/Jakarta) on January 15, 2012. The original Raffles Place branch closed in April 2011. The restaurant has been cited for its novel use of social media, and it was one of the first in Singapore to offer [Foursquare](/wiki/Foursquare_City_Guide) promotions. ## Accolades In March 2010, Standing Sushi Bar was voted #1 sushi in Singapore by the Hungrygowhere community. ## In popular culture In April 2011, Standing Sushi Bar created [sushi](/wiki/Sushi) rolls based on two of the most-talked about candidates ([Nicole Seah](/wiki/Nicole_Seah) and [Tin Pei Ling](/wiki/Tin_Pei_Ling)) during Singapore's general election. - [List of sushi restaurants](/wiki/List_of_sushi_restaurants) Portals: - Companies - Food - Official website - Company blog
